headline.main: SCIENTIFIC CONVENTION.; American Association for the Advancement of Science. EIGHTH MEETING AT WASHINGTON. FOURTH DAY--MORNING SESSION.

byline.original: Special Correspondence of the New-York Daily Times

headline.main: BROOKLYN CITY.; The James-street Affray. CIRCUIT COURT CALENDAR FOR THIS DAY. ATTEMPT TO KILL. MORTALITY.

docs.lead_paragraph: CORONER'S INQUEST.--The circumstances of this affray, which occurred on the night of Saturday, April 22, (a full account being published in the TIMES of the Monday following,) and resulted in the death of WILLIAM HUGHES, was investigated before Coroner BALL, yesterday, and the following Jurors:

headline.main: FOUR DAYS LATER FROM EUROPE.; ARRIVAL OF THE PACIFIC. Capture of Five Russian Ships by the English. SKIRMISHES ON THE DANUBE. Blockade of Odessa. Slight Improvement in Cotton and Breadstuffs.

docs.lead_paragraph: By the United States Mail steamer Pacific, at this port yesterday morning, from Liverpool Wednesday, April 19, we have four days' later intelligence from all parts of Europe. The Africa arrived at Liverpool at midnight of Monday, 17th.
docs.snippet: By the United States Mail steamer Pacific, at this port yesterday morning, from Liverpool Wednesday, April 19, we have four days' later intelligence from all parts of Europe. The Africa arrived at Liverpool at midnight of Monday, 17th.

headline.main: LATER FROM HAVANA.; Proceedings in Regard to the Black Warrior Postal Arrangements--Proscription of the Press.

docs.lead_paragraph: By the arrival of the Isabel, we are, in receipt of intelligence from Havana to the 21st of April. There is no news of importance. The authorities have resorted again to very stringent measures to prevent the circulation of incendiary matter through the Post-Office.
